, was recently interviewed on CNNMoney.com and revealed that he has a personal coach to help him be an extraordinary boss. ''Every athlete has a coach,'' Eric Schmidt rationalizes very confidently, and adds, People are never good at seeing themselves as others see them... a coach help's you see what you've been missing. six years during which he ran the Defense Department for President Bush , particularly because nearly two-thirds of the book deal with that relatively brief period in the author's life. But, as Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes, I don't spend a lot of time in recriminations, looking back or second-guessing decisions made in real time with imperfect information by myself or others. President Bush Donald Rumsfeld of State Colin Powell and National Security Adviser Condoleezza Rice , later secretary of state, are two colleagues who come in for a particular bashing, the former chairman of the joint chiefs as a self-interested operator
